intro: Hydrostachys distichophylla, commonly known as the two-feather sedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves arranged in two rows along the stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets, which are a defining feature of the sedge family. Hydrostachys distichophylla is often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its ecological role includes stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates and microorganisms.
